Nonbreeding adult.description: Nonbreeding American Golden-Plovers are brighter overall than nonbreeding Black-bellied Plovers with a more obvious white eyebrow. Nonbreeders also tend to have dingier underparts than Black-bellied Plovers.

Juvenile.description: Juvenile American Golden-Plovers often have golden tipped feathers and a darker cap that Black-bellied Plovers.

Breeding female.description: Breeding female American Golden-Plovers are more golden overall than breeding Black-bellied Plovers.

Breeding male.description: Breeding male American Gold Plovers have a mottled back with golden tones that are lacking on Black-bellied Plovers. Also note the cap is darker than Black-bellied.

Nonbreeding.description: Nonbreeding Pacific Golden-Plovers most often (but not always) show golden spots on the back and a pale yellow wash on the face that Black-bellied Plovers lack.

Breeding female.description: Breeding female Pacific Golden-Plovers have a mottled back with golden hues that Black-bellied Plovers lack.

Breeding male.description: Pacific Golden-Plovers have golden tipped feathers and a darker crown that Black-bellied Plovers lack.
